borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: The building shall not be occupied by patrons other than between the hours of 5:00am and 10:00pm on Tuesdays and Thursdays and between 7:30am and 10:00pm at all other times except for the first and final Friday of each calendar month. The main hall as shown on drawing no. 11208_PL02 shall not be occupied by patrons between the hours of 7:30am and 6:30pm from Monday to Friday. Reason:  To prevent the use causing any undue disturbance to occupants of neighbouring properties at unreasonable hours and to prevent a conflict of interest between the permitted use and neighbouring uses in accordance with policies BR9 and BP8 of the Borough Wide Development Policies DPD.

Within three months of the date of this decision a management plan showing how noise arising from the use will be minimised shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval. The approved plan shall be adhered to thereafter unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Reason: To prevent the use causing any undue disturbance to occupants of neighbouring properties and in accordance with policy BP8 of the Borough Wide Development Policies DPD.

Within three months of the date of this decision a scheme showing details of a means of disabled access to the building shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved scheme shall be implemented within one month of being approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and shall be retained permanently thereafter.  Reason: To ensure universal access and egress from the building in accordance with policy CC2 of the Core Strategy DPD.

Notwithstanding the details of drawing no. 11208_PL02, within three months of the date of this decision a revised car park layout which shall include at least 5 accessible parking bays shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval. The accessible spaces shall be clearly marked out in accordance with the standards outlined within the Parking Addendum to Chapter 6 of the London Plan and permanently retained for the use of disabled persons and their vehicles and for no other purpose. The scheme shall be constructed and marked out within one month of its written approval and thereafter retained permanently for the accommodation of vehicles of occupiers and visitors to the premises and not used for any other purpose. Reason: To ensure that sufficient off-street parking areas are provided and not to prejudice the free flow of traffic or conditions of general safety along the adjoining highway and to ensure and promote easier access for disabled persons to the development in accordance with policies BR9 and BP11 of the Borough Wide Development Policies DPD.

Within three months of the date of this decision a Travel Plan for the site which shall include proposals for minimising car-borne travel and encouraging walking, cycling and the use of public transport shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval. The approved Travel Plan shall be implemented immediately and monitored in accordance with the approved scheme thereafter.Reason:  In order to encourage the use of sustainable transport and in accordance with policy BR10 of the Borough Wide Development Policies DPD.

Within three months of the date of this decision details of a scheme of cycle parking shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval. The scheme shall be implemented within one month of their written approval by the Local Planning Authority and shall be retained permanently thereafter.Reason: In the interests of promoting cycling as a sustainable and non-polluting mode of transport and in accordance with policy BR11 of the Borough Wide Development Policies DPD.

The use hereby permitted shall be carried on by RCCG Living Faith Connections only and no other party, person or company.Reason: The use is only considered acceptable in view of the specific circumstances of the applicant and in order to assess the impact of the use if carried out by a different organisation.
